result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Yesko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: All costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. Inform Agent of a presciptions.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling. Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.   Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: First 90 Days are Straight Time with 69 Days Credit. Last 90 Days are with Day Report Center. If defendant ever tests positive for drugs, DRC will be revoked.
Previously imposed costs were converted to a civil judgment.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael J Yesko
Current: W242n6613 Locust St, Sussex, WI 53089 United States  (Effective: 06-28-2016)
Prior: 515 W Moreland Blvd, C/O Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

Defendant Michael J Yesko in court, in custody, with Attorney Daniel Skarie for Attorney Nathan John Dineen.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Grant Scaife appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises parties that it presided over Defendant's case in Drug Treatment Court.  Attorney Skarie states he does not take issue with this court hearing this case.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Skarie makes statements regarding sentencing.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  180 Days Jail - 1st 90 Days Straight time with 69 days credit, LAST 90 DAYS Day Report Center (if Defendant ever tests positive for drugs, DRC will be revoked) 

Any financial obligations previously ordered are ordered converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 23, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael J Yesko in court, in custody.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. First DTC appearance.  Court modifies bail to signature bond and orders Defendant to be RELEASED ON JANUARY 22, 2015 AT 9:00 A.M. DIRECTLY TO WCS STAFF.
Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract signed by all parties and approved by Judge Lloyd Carter

Defendant Michael J Yesko in court, in custody, with Attorney Dan Skarie for Attorney Nathan John Dineen.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Becky Van Dam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract and forwards the file to DTC.  Bail remains as fixed.
Plea hearing on January 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
